intro: Besenna anthelmintica, commonly known as the medicinal besenna, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant often grows in dry, rocky soils. Besenna anthelmintica has been traditionally used for its potential medicinal properties, including anthelmintic effects.
